src:
Novak Djokovic Rebut Gelar Paris Masters 2019
03 Nov 2019, 16:55 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Petenis Novak Djokovic keluar sebagai juara dalam turnamen Paris Masters 2019. Petenis unggulan pertama ini menang atas Denis Shapovalov dari Kanada dengan skor 6-3, 6-4, Minggu, 3 November 2019.
Djokovic mengoptimalkan satu-satunya break point dan memastikan kemenangan atas Shapovalov yang menempati peringkat 28 dunia. Keberhasilan ini makin memperpanjang gelar juara yang diraih Djokovic di Paris Masters menjadi lima kali. Selain itu, ia juga berpeluang menutup akhir tahun 2019 sebagai petenis nomor satu dunia.
Kini juara Grand Slam 16 kali ini sudah menjuarai 34 Masters. Ia berjarak satu gelar di bawah Rafael Nadal yang memuncaki daftar juara terbanyak. Ini juga trofi kelima Djokovic tahun ini usai menjuarai Wimbledon, Australia Open, Madrid Open, dan Tokyo Open. Ia juga berhak atas hadiah uang tunai sebesar 995.720 euro selain membawa pulang trofi Paris Masters.
Shapovalov mengatakan Djokovic sukses membuatnya bekerja keras sepanjang pertandingan. Tidak mudah bagi dia mencuri poin karena lawan begitu menguasai lapangan. "Dia tampil luar biasa sepanjang pekan ini," kata dia.
Kendati gagal meraih trofi, peringkat Shapovalov dipastikan akan melejit. Keberhasilannya melaju ke final Paris Masters, ia diprediksi menempati peringkat 15 besar dunia.

ATP TOUR
text:
Novak Djokovic Seizes the 2019 Paris Masters Title
03 Nov 2019, 16:55 by translations, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Tennis player Novak Djokovic won the 2019 Paris Masters tournament. The first seed won over Denis Shapovalov of Canada 6-3 6-4 on Sunday 3 November 2019.
Djokovic optimized his only break point and secured a victory over Shapovalov, who was ranked 28th in the world. This success further extended the title won by Djokovic at the Paris Masters to five times. In addition, he also has the opportunity to close the end of 2019 as world number one.
Now this 16-time Grand Slam champion has won 34 Masters. He is one degree below Rafael Nadal who tops the list of most champions. This is also Djokovic's fifth trophy this year after winning the Wimbledon, Australian Open, Madrid Open and Tokyo Open. He is also entitled to a cash prize of 995,720 euros in addition to taking home the Paris Masters trophy.
Shapovalov said Djokovic had succeeded in making him work hard throughout the match. It is not easy for him to steal points because the opponent is so in control of the field. "He has been outstanding all week," he said.
Despite failing to win the trophy, Shapovalov's ranking will certainly skyrocket. His success advanced to the final of the Paris Masters, he is predicted to rank in the world's top 15.

ATP TOUR
